labels.analysis: The MCP Quickbase Server is primarily designed to facilitate seamless integration with the Quickbase platform, enabling users to manage and automate various aspects of Quickbase applications. Its core functionality revolves around managing applications, tables, fields, records, and files through automated operations. The server supports querying data, creating and updating records, managing reports, and handling file uploads/downloads. These capabilities position it as a powerful tool for workflow automation and data management within the Quickbase ecosystem.
labels.reasoning: The primary label, Database Operations, is chosen because the server's primary functionality involves managing and interfacing with structured databases (applications, tables, and records) in Quickbase. API Integration is selected as a secondary label due to the server's reliance on API tokens and realm configurations for secure connectivity. The custom label, Quickbase Workflow Automation, is used to highlight the server's unique specialization in automating workflows within the Quickbase platform.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Quickbase Server
server_info_crawled.author: @danielbushman/mcp-quickbase
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable seamless integration with Quickbase to manage applications, tables, fields, records, and files through AI assistants. Perform operations like querying records, creating and updating data, and running reports with ease. Securely connect using your Quickbase API token and realm configuration for efficient workflow automation.

tools.name: test_connection
tools.description: Deploy Server Quickbase Server @danielbushman/mcp-quickbase Try in Playground test_connection

tools.name: configure_cache
tools.description: Configures caching behavior for Quickbase operations

tools.name: create_app
tools.description: Creates a new Quickbase application. Only use this tool when explicitly asked to create a new application.

tools.name: list_tables
tools.description: Lists all tables in the Quickbase application

tools.name: create_table
tools.description: Creates a new table in a Quickbase application

tools.name: get_table_fields
tools.description: Retrieves field information for a specific Quickbase table

tools.name: create_field
tools.description: Creates a new field in a Quickbase table

tools.name: update_field
tools.description: Updates an existing field in a Quickbase table

tools.name: query_records
tools.description: Executes a query against a Quickbase table with optional pagination

tools.name: create_record
tools.description: Creates a new record in a Quickbase table

tools.name: update_record
tools.description: Updates an existing record in a Quickbase table

tools.name: bulk_create_records
tools.description: Creates multiple records in a Quickbase table

tools.name: bulk_update_records
tools.description: Updates multiple records in a Quickbase table

tools.name: upload_file
tools.description: Uploads a file to a field in a Quickbase record

tools.name: download_file
tools.description: Downloads a file from a field in a Quickbase record

tools.name: run_report
tools.description: Execute a Quickbase report with optional filters and parameters

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@danielbushman/mcp-quickbase/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
